You can check with the developer info (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/how-to-use-developer-info-on-cos-pages>) what is the snippet you need to use, probably something like:
`{{ widget_data.module_XXXXX.yourField.body.value }}`
In reality both the snippet code and the preview opacity value exist. I think it's a little visual bug
I've done it before like this `{{ content.widgets.modules_name.body.field_name }}`
<@U7ADCU3BM> is right. This in intentional due to poor support for `opacity` and `rgba()` in email clients. If you need an opacity option, you can add a number field.
<@UHA0L28CW> the snippet in `email` modules should not include the `opacity` token, that’s a bug
Hi i have a question about color field. How can i hide the opacity selector?  See image in this thread .Thank you

Hello
<@UH8USUDNF> here!
I want to help everyone's HubSpot project!
Hi <@UH8USUDNF> , thanks for your offer to help everyone!!. I have a question about color field when creating a module. How can i hide the opacity selector?

<@UGXTYTX4Y> why do you want to hide the opacity selector from the module?
A module is a 'module', and you don't need to remove it
You use its attributes in your code and if you need opacity 1, you can use only the color in your code without using the opacity
If you don't use the opacity attribute in your code, the opacity value won't affect your color

I know all that, but I don’t want to provide to the user something that is useless and very distractive. I believe that should be an option to hide it, similar to when you hide the width/height selectors in an ‘image’ field. Thank you for your response though
<@UGXTYTX4Y> If you tag your module for use in email, is disabled the opacity. But then it will disabled the CSS & JS windows
I did it,  but it did not work. Disabling CSS and JS is a pretty bad side effect . I just going to leave it there. I’ll suggest an option to hide this to HS developers. Thank you

I can’t replace an image in the page editor but i had no problem when i tested while i was building the module? Any idea what’s going on. HS feels pretty buggy.
